page.title: 01THE PARISH OF ESKDALEMUIR.
page.content: Eskdalemuir, the largest parish in Dumfriesshire lies in the north eastern corner of the county.It covers the upper part of the River Esk.Its altitude varies form 650ft to 2270ft at Ettrick Pen at the head of the valley.It has been heavily glaciated,hence its characteristic rounded hills with gentle slopes. Originally covered by primaeval forest it was cleared of timber by the ninteenth century, and given over to sheep farming. Now in 1980's due to afforestation started by the Forestry Commission in 1938 and also the Economic Forestry Group in 1965, there remain only seven sheep farms including some integrated forestry and farming estates.
